get.summary: server-capabilities: Fetch the server FHIR CapabilityStatement

post.description:
This operation accepts a message, processes it according to the definition of the event in the message header, and returns one or more response messages.  

In addition to processing the message event, a server may choose to retain all or some the resources and make them available on a RESTful interface, but is not required to do so.
 Supported Messages 


 bars-message-servicerequest-request 
 --------------------
 `https://fhir.nhs.uk/MessageDefinition/bars-message-servicerequest-request` 
 BARS Message Definition ServiceRequest - Request CaseTransfer
 

 MessageHeader.eventCoding = **servicerequest-request** 


 | Resource | Profile | Min | Max | 
|----------|---------|-----|-----| 
| Bundle | [BARSBundleMessage](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/BARSBundleMessage.guide.md) | 1 | 1 | 
| MessageHeader | [BARSMessageHeader-servicerequest-request](https://simplifier.net/guide/NHSDigital/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/Profiles/BARSMessageHeader-servicerequest-request.guide.md) | 1 | 1 |

parameters.name: patient:identifier
parameters.description: The patient identifier (e.g. NHS Number) that the service request is about

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The free/busy status of the appointment

parameters.name: _include
parameters.description: Inclusions that drive the rescusive depth of the search

parameters.name: patient:identifier
parameters.description: Search for appointment for a patient by NHS Number

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The uri that identifies the MessageDefintiion

CapabilityStatement.description: See resource [CapabilityStatement](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/CapabilityStatement.html). HL7 FHIR R4 Schema can be found here [HL7 FHIR Downloads](https://www.hl7.org/fhir/downloads.html)
